Since each of us can see only a small part of the picture they seem random.

I develop a deep gnawing desire for the sense of solitude n inner peace in whose pursuit I hike into the forests. Its 1900 hrs, I am at the centre of all the hub in Bangalore, MG road. I just finished my classes and got out onto the wet streets. So, what do I do ??? I decide to walk. A walk along the crowded paths, the noise of the vehicles, the shouts of the salesmen, I can clearly hear the people around me speak as they trot along immersed in their own lives. My senses have become acute. I hear a radio playin in a shop, a street urchin crying, honking of vehicles, couples with love in their eyes, another in a tiff, man in dark glasses checkin out the birdies , another waiting for customers in his make shift studio, the chat walla making good buisness, the guy with the corn eagerly warming up the coals to tempt passerbys, roasted groundnuts in a cone of paper sellin like hot cakes, a familiar face ... I walk ... the world has become naked ... I walk some more ... Everything changes when it rains - the smoke from all the exhausts looks like the fog in a thick forest, the smell of rain, of coffee, of flowers, of fruits, of chats, of ciggarette smoke, of beedis, of all the different fragrances that people have soaked themselves in ... It feels like I am watching a movie but I am one of the actors. A movie within a movie... I look at my watch and it just been 5 minutes ... yet it feels like an eternity ... It looks like its gonna rain some more. I get to the parking lot and head for home. The roads are muddy, they are in bad shape, and a segment has been closed along the way. I run into a traffic jam. A major bottle neck , takes me an hour to navigate out off. An auto almost runs over my foot, a car nudges me as it overtakes, bikes in front spit muddy water in continous streaks. I get splashed all around by the vehicles plyin along. The battery in my bike is dead. I honk and hear nothing. The indicators won't work. Must be the water. Atleast the headlights are on. Overtaking and safe driving is a different ball game now. The roads are packed. Each tryin to outdo the other. More splashes. Lots of hidden ditches in the pools of water collected. I make my own splashes of slush in the ditches, most of it falling on me.... I am humming a tune.... I reach home ,I smell like the roads outside and I am still humming the tune I heard on MG road... This is a first - I have no anecdotes to say, no one liners to spit ... A feeling so different and yet so familiar...

urlLink Goa trip / year 2000 I am walkin along the beach looking around at all the beautiful scenery; which includes the water thrashing onto rocks in a foamy rush, the wind, the waves, the beach, the heat and all the pretty- scantily clad birds n mermaids :) Completely engrossed / absorbed in the above mentioned scenery I walk, I trot , steal a few sights and this European with long hair walks past me. Something inside me whispers turn around dude . I look back and Voila ! this is the sight. Now, its a mad crazy frenzy. I grasp my fully manual Vivitar with a 50 mm lens ( now retired ) take the cap off, bring it to my eye, set the apperture at my fav 8.0, check with the exposure meter and set my shutter speed. All this so I could get a shiloutte shot. And just when this Gentleman was about to disappear out of my view along the bend I take the shot. Now, I am sure I missed him. I feel bad, I feel sick that I was too slow. I beat myself up for trying all the technical jargon. I put this program in my mind on loop. I think of all the possible time saving tactics I could have employed with my fully manual - always keep the cap off when there are potential subjects, keep the camera in a safe setting like 8.0 and 125 or 11.0 and 125 so that atleast there is a photograph, I condemn myself to the planet of retards. I comeback home after my 3 day trip and get the snaps processed . Well ! I actually got the photograph that I had wanted. This has made me realize something. Condemn u'rself but don't let it loop . And shoot more aggresively to compensate. hahahaha I will never change!!! I am critical to others and the same applies to me ... crap!

urlLink so green and so wet, it was nature at its best. urlLink Budangiri Trek ( Jan 2004 ) I was mesmerised by the beauty of colors & the play of light. It was a refreshing sight after a long & tiring hike on an unsure path. It was time to rejoice and remember that it was for sights like these that we had walked into the jungles of Bhadra Wildlife Sanctuary. We were hungry ( had run out of food). We had not seen anyone else since the time we bid our byes to locals at Gaalikere ( Lake of Winds ) and that was 2 days ago. We did not know whether we were going much further into the jungle or were on our path out. The sanctuary is such that if u get lost u can stay that way for days to weeks ( its that thick ). We mostly hiked on the hills encircling the sanctuary like a horseshoe and once in a while dipping into the thick jungles and cutting across the sholas. We followed many tracks that led to waterholes making us realize that it was not a trail left by humans but were animal trails. Misled by the trails, not having the advantage of height in the valleys & sholas . the direction changing every few steps, the terrain changing every few kilometers . It was only our experience that helped us in making critical decisions. Such a refreshing sight I was spellbound and forgot all that was & all that can (be) and breathed only the now . It was such a moment. It was the Perfect Stream.
